de.upb.t2t.control.gui.transcriber

Class TranscriptionSegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.VBox
              • de.upb.t2t.control.gui.transcriber.TranscriptionSegment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class TranscriptionSegment
extends javafx.scene.layout.VBox

    One of the central classes when it comes to displaying a piece of transcription to the user. A TranscriptionSegment is visually divided into to layers, the first of which featuring the lemma that a user has typed in. Said lemma is surrounded by a potential leading and trailing String which may contain any non-word characters. In general, there is no user action happening in this part.

    The second layer presents the user with a list of (usually) WordButtons representing the broad phonetic transcription of the lemma. The most likely case is that only one WordButton is required to do so. However, it may also be possible that a numeral consisting of digits or any other special input has to be transcribed. With "200" serving as an example, the buttonBox would then be filled with two WordButtons showing /tuː hʌndred/.

    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de)
    See Also:
    Transcriber, DelimiterButton

    • Constructor Detail

      • TranscriptionSegment

        public TranscriptionSegment()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.net.URISyntaxException
        Convenience constructor for the TranscriptionSegment class. Will instantiate an empty / blank segment.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if TranscriptionSegment(String, String, String) throws one.
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if TranscriptionSegment(String, String, String) throws one.

      • TranscriptionSegment

        public TranscriptionSegment(java.lang.String lemma)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.net.URISyntaxException
        Convenience constructor for the TranscriptionSegment class. Will automatically set the lemmaButton's text property.
        Parameters:
        lemma - the lemma to be displayed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if TranscriptionSegment(String, String, String) throws one.
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if TranscriptionSegment(String, String, String) throws one.

      • TranscriptionSegment

        public TranscriptionSegment(java.lang.String leading,
                            java.lang.String lemma,
                            java.lang.String trailing)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.net.URISyntaxException
        A constructor for the TranscriptionSegment class. It uses an FXMLLoader to parse all its contents and then sets itself as both root and controller of the resulting object.
        Parameters:
        leading - the String preceding the lemma (e.g. punctuation characters).
        lemma - the lemma to transcribe.
        trailing - the String following the lemma (e.g. punctuation characters).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the FXMLLoader throws one.
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the FXMLProvider throws one.
